In this session we will be discussing from the 38th verse of the 8th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Continuing the prayers by Queen Kunti.
KVAYAM NAMA ROOPABHYAM YADUBI SAHAPANDAVAH
BHAVATO ADHARSHANAM YARIHI HRISHIKANAM IVESHITUHU
The meaning of this verse is

As the name and fame of a particular body is finished with the disappearance of the living spirit, similarly, if you do not look upon us, all our fame and activities, along with the Pandavas and Yadus, will end at once.

This is yet another prayer offered by Queen Kunti to Krishna, that the devotees are very well aware that their existence is totally dependent on Krishna, and only because of Krishna's mercy, they are able to perform their duties.
They are able to perform activities in a nice way. And the example is being given, when the spirit soul leaves the body, the body is a useless piece of dead matter.
But as long as the spirit is there, the body is having so many nice life symptoms.

Actually, the body is always matter, dead matter. But the presence of the spirit makes it appear to be having life. And the absence of the spirit means immediately the body starts decomposing. It cannot be sustained anymore.
So in the Parpochila, Prabhupada explains,
The body is quite aware that the existence of the Pandavas is due to Shri Krishna only.
This point has to be very, very nicely understood. And only then we become very serious in Krishna consciousness and not be complacent in our practice.
In this material world, while we are still here, we should not be complacent.
We should know that every moment I should be dependent on Krishna's mercy only.
And for that, I have to be Krishna conscious always, not sometimes, always.
The Pandavas are undoubtedly well established in name and fame and are guided by a great king, Yudhishthira, whose morality personified.
He is called Dharma because he is morality personified.
And the Yadus are undoubtedly great allies of the Pandavas.
But without the guidance of Lord Krishna, all of them are non-entities.

The object that is seen makes some sense, we make some sense out of it, what it is or what is the purpose or what it is, what my relationship with it is, etc., etc., only because there is the background consciousness for the seeing, for the hearing, for the thinking, for the feeling, everything.

There is a background consciousness. No one should be proud of his prestige, power and fame, without being guided by the favor of the Supreme Lord. He will be always conscious of this favor of the Supreme Lord upon each one of us, under all circumstances.
The living beings are always dependent and the ultimate dependable object is the Lord himself.
We should never wrongly think that I am dependent on something other than Krishna, someone other than Krishna. No, that is not possible.
We may therefore invent by our advancement of material knowledge all sorts of counteracting material resources, but without being guided by the Lord.
